hints.content: First, we need to find $3\dfrac12$ feet on the number line.

$3\dfrac12$ is after $3$ but before $4$.

[[☃ image 1]]

There are $4$ equal parts, or fourths, between each whole. We can use equivalent fractions to label each tick.

[[☃ image 2]]

options.alt: A line plot has, moving left to right, tick marks labeled 3 and 4. Between these labeled tick marks are 3 equally-spaced unlabeled tick marks. !
A line plot has, moving left to right, tick marks labeled 3, 3 and one-fourth, 3 and one-half, 3 and three-fourths, and 4. The tick mark at 3 and one-half is highlighted. !

hints.content:
Each dot represents one sunflower. 

So, we need to count all of the dots on the line plot that represent sunflowers that are $3\dfrac12$ feet long.

[[☃ image 1]]

There are $\goldE2$ dots that represent lengths that are $3\dfrac12$ feet.

options.alt: A line plot labeled sunflower height (feet) shows, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, and 10. Three unlabeled tick marks appear between each labeled tick mark. Dots are plotted as follows: 2 dots above the first unlabeled tick mark after 3, 2 dots above the second unlabeled tick mark after 3, 3 dots above 4, 1 dot above the first unlabeled tick mark after 4, 1 dot above the first unlabeled tick mark after 5, 2 dots above the second unlabeled tick mark after 5, 1 dot above the first unlabeled tick mark after 6, 4 dots above 7, 2 dots above the second unlabeled tick mark after 7, 3 dots above the first unlabeled tick mark after 8, 1 dot above the third unlabeled tick mark after 8, and 2 dots above the first unlabeled tick mark after 9. The second unlabeled tick mark after 3 and 2 dots above it are highlighted. !

question.content:
The heights of some sunflowers are shown below.  

[[☃ image 1]]

**How many sunflowers are $3\dfrac12$ feet long?** 
 
[[☃ input-number 1]] sunflowers

options.alt: A line plot labeled sunflower height (feet) shows, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, and 10. Three unlabeled tick marks appear between each labeled tick mark. Dots are plotted as follows: 2 dots above the first unlabeled tick mark after 3, 2 dots above the second unlabeled tick mark after 3, 3 dots above 4, 1 dot above the first unlabeled tick mark after 4, 1 dot above the first unlabeled tick mark after 5, 2 dots above the second unlabeled tick mark after 5, 1 dot above the first unlabeled tick mark after 6, 4 dots above 7, 2 dots above the second unlabeled tick mark after 7, 3 dots above the first unlabeled tick mark after 8, 1 dot above the third unlabeled tick mark after 8, and 2 dots above the first unlabeled tick mark after 9. !
